ref: 8761 prálīyatē ʻ is dissolved, disappears ʼ ŚBr. 2. Pp. pralīna -- MBh. [Cf. práriṇāti ʻ takes away ʼ RV. <-> √lī2]
Kho. pulik ʻ to become addled or rotten or crumbly or worn -- out (egg, stone, wood, clothes), be lost (as a sum owed) ʼ, púli ʻ rotten, addled ʼ or perh. with BelvalkarVol 94 < *pūliya -- .
